column4: I have a question, how came Nvidia Drivers break when you install linux-restricted-modules ?!??
I'm pretty sure I need the linux-restricted-modules to get some of my devices working such as my webcam
if you read above i said, when you install linux-restricted-modules is breaks nvidia driver
im on edgy w/ nvidia 9625 beta btw
If I use the nvidia-glx drivers from the repo's...can I have the restricted modules installed?
Can someone help me get my logitech quickcam working?..its listed under lsusb, but camorama and other programs dont recognize it
probably you need to load a kernel module
lsusb will see it at the vendor id/device id level, without kernel support, but the programs won't see it without kernel support
do you know what kernel module i need to load?
you just said i need to load some kernel module..probably..thankyou for your input really..However im not sure what that kernel module is, so im asking to anyoen else who might give me some help
if what you need to do is load a kernel module, you can ask all day, but nothing will happen until you figure out how to load a kernel module
i know how to load a kernel module,..i just dont know which one..thankyou
your not the end all to my search for help pal
im not wasting time if im still trying to find out which module to load am I?
its people like you who turn away new users to linux..stop acting self-righteous
well, my humblest apologies for trying to help you.
